articles.headline: Biden Policies Offer Benefits, but Little Political Payoff, in Pennsylvania
articles.snippet: As inflation worries dominate, the Biden administration is struggling to take credit for infrastructure and industrial policy in the battleground state.
articles.abstract: As inflation worries dominate, the Biden administration is struggling to take credit for infrastructure and industrial policy in the battleground state.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a blighted industrial corridor in a struggling section of Erie, Pa., a long-abandoned iron factory has been humming with activity for the first time in decades. Construction crews have been removing barrels of toxic waste, knocking down crumbling walls and salvaging rusted tin roofing as they prepare to convert the cavernous space into an events venue, advanced manufacturing hub and brewery.
articles.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: J.D. Vance Is Trump’s Pick for Vice President
articles.snippet: A political newcomer and former Trump critic turned ally, Senator Vance is an ambitious ideologue who relishes the spotlight and has already shown he can energize donors.
articles.abstract: A political newcomer and former Trump critic turned ally, Senator Vance is an ambitious ideologue who relishes the spotlight and has already shown he can energize donors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow the latest news from the Republican National Convention.

articles.headline: The Gunshots Rang Out. Then the Conspiracy Theories Erupted Online.
articles.snippet: Claims that President Biden and his allies ordered the attack on Donald J. Trump, or that Mr. Trump staged the attack, started quickly and spread fast across social media.
articles.abstract: Claims that President Biden and his allies ordered the attack on Donald J. Trump, or that Mr. Trump staged the attack, started quickly and spread fast across social media.
articles.lead_paragraph: Four minutes after the first report of a shooting at a rally for Donald J. Trump on Saturday, an anonymous account on X posted, “Joe Biden’s antifa shot President Trump.”
articles.byline: By Tiffany Hsu, Sheera Frenkel and Ken Bensinger

articles.headline: Secret Service Faces Questions About Leaving Building Out of Security Zone
articles.snippet: Overlapping investigations will focus on the decisions the protection agency made before and immediately after bullets nearly hit former President Trump directly.
articles.abstract: Overlapping investigations will focus on the decisions the protection agency made before and immediately after bullets nearly hit former President Trump directly.
articles.lead_paragraph: The building from which a gunman fired at former President Trump on Saturday was — at least in hindsight — an obvious security risk. Its rooftop offered an ideal sniper’s perch, with a close, elevated and unobstructed view of Mr. Trump.
articles.byline: By David A. Fahrenthold, Zolan Kanno-Youngs, Christina Morales and Mark Walker

articles.headline: Dysfunction Sidelines Ukraine’s Parliament as Governing Force
articles.snippet: With the president’s party split, the government relies on formerly pro-Russian lawmakers to help it pass legislation and, the opposition says, minimize scrutiny.
articles.abstract: With the president’s party split, the government relies on formerly pro-Russian lawmakers to help it pass legislation and, the opposition says, minimize scrutiny.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ukraine’s Parliament is in a state of disarray.

articles.headline: How J.D. Vance Won Over Donald Trump
articles.snippet: It started with a meeting at Mar-a-Lago more than three years ago. Later, Tucker Carlson, Elon Musk and other key allies made direct appeals on his behalf.
articles.abstract: It started with a meeting at Mar-a-Lago more than three years ago. Later, Tucker Carlson, Elon Musk and other key allies made direct appeals on his behalf.
articles.lead_paragraph: The meeting got off to a bad start.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Swan and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Why Is the Oil Industry Booming?
articles.snippet: High prices and growing demand have helped U.S. oil producers take in record profits despite global efforts to spur greater use of renewable energy and electric cars.
articles.abstract: High prices and growing demand have helped U.S. oil producers take in record profits despite global efforts to spur greater use of renewable energy and electric cars.
articles.lead_paragraph: For all of the focus on an energy transition, the American oil industry is booming, extracting more crude than ever from the shale rock that runs beneath the ground in West Texas.
articles.byline: By Rebecca F. Elliott and Desiree Rios

articles.headline: Elon Musk Enters Uncharted Territory With Trump Endorsement
articles.snippet: The owner of X broke with tradition at other social media companies to support the former president, as he drives political conversation on his site.
articles.abstract: The owner of X broke with tradition at other social media companies to support the former president, as he drives political conversation on his site.
articles.lead_paragraph: Roughly 30 minutes after former President Donald J. Trump was shot at a rally in Pennsylvania on Saturday, Elon Musk backed his bid for the White House.
articles.byline: By Kate Conger and Ryan Mac

articles.headline: After Saturday, Trump’s Devotees See ‘God’s Protection’
articles.snippet: Some of Donald J. Trump’s followers had long viewed him as handpicked by God. The attempted assassination has only increased such quasi-religious devotion and rhetoric.
articles.abstract: Some of Donald J. Trump’s followers had long viewed him as handpicked by God. The attempted assassination has only increased such quasi-religious devotion and rhetoric.
articles.lead_paragraph: For Donald J. Trump’s most devoted supporters, the bullet that nicked his ear and came within inches of ending his life was only further proof that a higher power is looking out for him.
articles.byline: By Michael C. Bender, Andrew Trunsky and Neil Vigdor

articles.headline: Is It Silicon Valley’s Job to Make Guaranteed Income a Reality?
articles.snippet: The tech community, led by Sam Altman of OpenAI, has funded programs that give people unconditional cash. Some say it’s time to scale up.
articles.abstract: The tech community, led by Sam Altman of OpenAI, has funded programs that give people unconditional cash. Some say it’s time to scale up.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the last couple of years, the tech community has tested no-strings-attached payments of $500 or $1,000 a month to those in dire need. Some of these experiments have happened in the heart of Silicon Valley, where a one-bedroom apartment rents for $3,000 a month and a modest house is often an unaffordable luxury.
